ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This was the first time I had taken on a research/writing project of this size. I learned to read and research for a long term project, think about textual and manuscript issues, and write an extended essay.
I learned how to tackle a large writing project beyond any 10-12 page paper I've ever written for an English course.

I learned how to write a 35-page paper and delve into a semester's worth of research into the topic of my choosing. Writing the paper was the hardest part of the process and I learned a lot about my writing and editing style.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think the weekly support sessions with the other students were really helpful. I wish I had engaged with them more than I did. Because every senior essay experience is unique to each project, I'm not sure what might be done to improve the course.

I think it's really a personal journey with your own writing and your advisor, as you get to learn who you are as a writer and what writing style/discipline works for you. The strength of this course was the weekly check-ins, but I wish there was more of a community in the class about showing up to these meetings. A weakness of the course was the writing retreats - I wish they were actually more "retreat"-like, a bit away from typical study spots or writing spots on campus, such as a trek to the very beautiful Divinity School library or to a coffeeshop - adds a bit more fun incentive to the hard writing process! Also wish we discussed more about citations.
I really liked how a previous thesis-writer came and talked to our cohort. I would have appreciated a few (one or two) more of these interactions, because I found it extremely helpful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! I think the senior essay is a great opportunity to delve into a personal intellectual pursuit that you otherwise would not be able to access. I'm so glad that I decided to do one.
Yes. The essay experience was fantastic, and can help those who participate greatly.

If you have a topic you care about that you don't think you'd be able to take on in a senior seminar, write a senior essay! But it's hard work, no joke, as it's a long journey or writing and working with your text, but also too short of a time to feel as though you can do everything you set out to do. It's easy to feel bogged down by all the reading you need to do to even begin, and more bogged down by all the writing you end up doing!
